En tant qu'ingénieur logiciel chez Meta, vous piloterez le développement des systèmes qui sous-tendent les produits de Meta, créerez des applications web qui touchent des milliards de personnes, construirez des serveurs à haut volume et ferez partie d'une équipe qui s'efforce d'aider les gens à se connecter les uns aux autres dans le monde entier. Ce poste est à temps plein et les déplacements sont minimes.-------

Software Engineer, University Grad | Ingénieur logiciel, diplômé de l’université Responsibilities:



Develop a strong understanding of relevant product area, codebase, and/or systems | Développer une solide compréhension du secteur des produits, de la base de code et/ou des systèmes concernés

Demonstrate proficiency in data analysis, programming and software engineering | Démontrer des compétences en analyse de données, en programmation et en génie logiciel

Produce high quality code with good test coverage, using modern abstractions and frameworks | Produire un code de haute qualité avec une bonne couverture de test, en utilisant des abstractions et des cadres modernes

Work independently, use available resources to get unblocked, and complete tasks on-schedule by exercising strong judgement and problem solving skills | Travailler de manière autonome, utiliser les ressources disponibles pour se débloquer et accomplir les tâches dans les délais impartis en faisant preuve d'un grand discernement et de compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes

Master Meta’s development standards from developing to releasing code in order to take on tasks and projects with increasing levels of complexity | Maîtriser les normes de développement de Meta, du développement à la publication du code, afin d'entreprendre des tâches et des projets d'un niveau de complexité croissant.

Actively seek and give feedback in alignment with Meta’s Performance Philosophy | Rechercher activement et donner des retours en accord avec la philosophie de performance de Meta.



Minimum Qualifications:



Experience coding in an industry-standard language (e.g. Java, Python, C++, JavaScript) | Expérience du codage dans un langage standard du secteur (par exemple, Java, Python, C++, JavaScript)

Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment | Le candidat doit obtenir un permis de travail dans le pays où il travaille au moment de son recrutement et la conserver pendant toute la durée de son contrat.



Preferred Qualifications:



Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, work experience, coding competitions, or publications | Expérience avérée dans l’ingénierie logicielle acquise dans le cadre d’un stage précédent, d’une expérience professionnelle, de concours de codage ou de publications

Demonstrated problem solving skills and ability to compare alternative solutions, trade offs, and diverse points of view when building a feature or product | Compétences avérées en matière de résolution de problèmes et capacité à comparer des solutions alternatives, des compromis et divers points de vue lors de la création d'une fonctionnalité ou d'un produit.

Demonstrated success working and communicating cross functionally in a team environment | Capacité avérée à travailler et à communiquer de manière transversale dans un environnement d'équipe.

Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or a related field | Avoir ou être en train d'obtenir une licence ou une maîtrise en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe

We are looking for a 
Cloud Engineer 
who will design and build highly scalable, secure, and highly available architectures, promote automation and infrastructure best practices. They will contribute to a team of like-minded platform engineers building platforms in Azure, AWS and GCP public clouds. Will also
 minimize the risk of reliability-related failure outcomes as pertaining to durability, availability, performance, and correctness, w
rite code and scripts to automate infrastructure and other common workflows.





Required qualifications (Must Have): 



Experience with Infrastructure Automation and Infrastructure as Code

Proficiency with any public cloud (Azure/AWS/GCP) services and infrastructure.

3+ years of experience working with one or more of: Python, GO, Ruby, Java

A passion for making developers more efficient through DevOps, CI/CD, and Infrastructure as Code


 


Nice to Have 



Experience in Kubernetes (Building Operators and managing production workloads) 

Knowledge of SRE principles

An aptitude for learning and solutions design

Description:* Actalent is looking for a product (software/system) verification specialist. This individual will provide detailed implementations for test coverage, automation, validation, and documentation to ensure the delivery of client's advanced optical transport solutions are high quality and robust.



Key Responsibilities:


Design test plans and strategies to conduct full characterization of optical interface products

Execute test plans to evaluate equipment performance against design requirements

Document test progress, results and assist with investigations and issue resolution

Develop, execute, and maintain automated tests in Python for future use in regression testing

Investigate and fix automated test case failures as part of regression testing

Participate in technical design document review throughout design and verification cycle

Contribute and improve test automation framework and team processes *Top Skills Details:* Seeking Software Test Engineer or Product Verification Engineer with 3+ years of the following: 1) Python for automation 2) Understanding of OSI layers 1,2,3 and application layer (layer 7)

 Worked with telecom equipment handling those layers *Additional Skills & Qualifications:*

Extensive experience developing automated test cases and test frameworks in Python

Extensive experience of software version control using Git or SVN

Solid Knowledge of network concept, Layer 0/1 and Application protocols (Ethernet, OTN)

Experience in working with Bugzilla, Jira or similar defect tracking system

Experience with testing and monitoring equipment such as EXFO, VIAVI or similar (asset)

Experience in testing optical transport devices and system solutions (asset)

Experience in testing Radius and TACACS+ (asset)



À propos d'Actalent:

Actalent relie la passion à la mission. Nos solutions de candidats talentueux et la performance de nos services produisent la valeur et les résultats, tout en apportant la compétence qui permet à nos clients de réaliser plus. Nos experts situés dans le monde entier inspirent au quotidien. Nous soutenons les initiatives essentielles en ingénierie et en sciences, par les expériences qui favorisent un développement continu. La différence, c’est nos gens. Actalent est une société d’exploitation d’Allegis Group, leader mondial des solutions de candidats talentueux.

L’entreprise souscrit au principe d’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et prendra en compte toutes les candidatures sans distinction de race, sexe, âge, couleur, religion, nationalité, statut de vétéran, handicap, orientation sexuelle, identité sexuelle, information génétique ou toute autre distinction protégée par la loi.

About Actalent:

Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Job Description




Job Responsibilities: 



Develop and maintain developing QA test environment.

Reproducing and troubleshooting the bug with developer.

Write QA tests and report on issues found in new software and reliability thereof 

Hands on in bug fixing current products.




Job Experience Required




5+ years of operations experience in Unix/Linux environment is essential 

Experience with Chef, Puppet, or another configuration management and deployment system

Strong HTTP knowledge at the protocol level 

Knowledge of TCP/IP networking, firewalls, switching and routing is essential

Good problem solving and troubleshooting skills 

Highly motivated and responsible quick learner 

Familiar with system installations, configurations, and troubleshooting

Knowledge of at least one scripting language: Shell, Ruby, Perl, Python, etc

Able to read and understand at least one higher level language, e.g. C

Knowledge of general QA procedures and methodologies as well as develops 

fundamentals

Able to communicate effectively, both verbal and written 




Educational Requirement




B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience


#GD

Enterprise Engineering is at the heart of Facebook's mission. By transforming the way businesses function, we are helping to bring billions of people around the world closer together. This requires unconventional thinking and lightning-fast, nimble solutions. We build enterprise products for Facebook first. We also bring many of our products to millions of professionals outside Facebook by making these available on the Workplace enterprise collaboration platform. Enterprise Engineers build industry leading, highly intuitive software that underpin business functions across Supply Chain, Finance, Sales, Marketing, E-commerce and Security. Our products consistently influence the enterprise software industry by defining new standards for how our customers, internally and externally, relate to their daily work. We are looking for someone that has strong experience building complex transactional systems with high availability, data integrity, and reliability.-------L'ingénierie d'entreprise est au cœur de la mission de Facebook. En transformant le fonctionnement des entreprises, nous contribuons à rapprocher des milliards de personnes dans le monde. Cela nécessite une réflexion inconventionnelle et des solutions ultra-rapides. Nous créons des produits d'entreprise pour Facebook en premier. Nous proposons également beaucoup de nos produits à des millions de professionnels en dehors de Facebook en les rendant disponibles sur la plateforme de collaboration d'entreprise Workplace. Les ingénieurs d'entreprise créent des logiciels de pointe et hautement intuitifs qui sous-tendent les fonctions commerciales de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, des finances, des ventes, de la commercialisation, du commerce électronique et de la sécurité. Nos produits influencent constamment l’industrie des logiciels d’entreprise en définissant de nouvelles normes régissant le rapport de nos clients, tant en interne qu’en externe, avec leur travail au quotidien. Nous recherchons une personne avec une grande expérience dans la création de systèmes transactionnels complexes avec haute disponibilité, intégrité des données et fiabilité.

Enterprise Engineer | Ingénieur d’entreprise Responsibilities:



Build industry leading enterprise systems that are highly available, intuitive, scalable, and secure | Créer des systèmes d’entreprise de pointe, hautement disponibles, intuitifs, évolutifs et sécurisés.

Work with product managers, designers and other engineers to create software that optimizes for business metrics | Travailler avec les gestionnaires de produits, les concepteurs et autres ingénieurs pour créer des logiciels qui sont optimisés pour les données commerciales.

Produce highly reliable and performant code with appropriate monitoring and alerting | Produire un code hautement fiable et performant avec une surveillance et des alertes appropriées.

Conduct design and code reviews to ensure scalability, performance and alignment with standards and best practices | Effectuer des revues de conception et de code pour assurer l’évolutivité, les performances et l’alignement sur les normes et les meilleures pratiques.

Follow release management policies to ensure data integrity, compliance and system stability | Suivre les politiques de gestion des versions pour garantir l’intégrité des données, la conformité et la stabilité du système.



Minimum Qualifications:



3+ years of experience building intuitive systems in Java, PHP, C++ or JavaScript technologies such as ReactJS or AngularJS | Plus de 3 ans d'expérience dans la création de systèmes intuitifs en Java, PHP, C++ ou technologies JavaScript comme ReactJS ou AngularJS.

3+ years experience working with code bases building micro services, REST APIs, GraphQL | Plus de 3 ans d'expérience dans l'élaboration de bases de code pour la création de microservices, d'API REST et de GraphQL

3+ years experience modelling data flows between systems to enable transactional workflows and upstream/downstream integrations | Plus de 3 ans d'expérience dans la modélisation de flux de données entre systèmes pour activer les flux de travaux transactionnels et les intégrations en amont et en aval

3+ years experience building secure software with auditable access controls and permissions | Plus de 3 ans d'expérience dans la création de logiciels sécurisés avec des contrôles d'accès et des permissions vérifiables

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience | Être titulaire d'une licence en informatique, en génie informatique, dans un domaine technique pertinent, ou justifier d'une expérience pratique équivalente.



Preferred Qualifications:

- Specialized higher education (e.g. Software Engineering or Computer Science) and/or significant experience in Software Development
- Significant experience developing in PHP 7+ and solid foundations in OOP (Object Oriented Programming)
- Experience working with REST API responses in JSON
- Experience working with NoSQL data storage (e.g. MongoDB, Firestore)
- Experience with one or more modern PHP frameworks, such as Laravel, Yii, Symfony, etc.
- Experience with RESTful API development and microservices
- Experience with correctly leveraging caching systems (e.g. Redis), and implementing queuing systems (e.g. RabbitMQ)
- Knowledge of relational (e.g. MySQL) and non-relational databases (e.g. MongoDB)
- Knowledge of the Web environment (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
- Very well versed in Git (both GUI and command line) and best practices in version control for mobile development
- Experience with unit testing in a CI/CD environment
Very strong analytical and written communication skills
- Capacity to quickly learn and get familiar with the ins and outs of multiple interconnected systems

Experience with any of the following is an asset/bonus:
- AWS SDKs and APIs
- Docker
- Microsoft Azure
- Experience with Angular and/or React
- Experience with Node.js and a Node.js framework such as Express.js or Nest.js
- Experience with Event Driven programming
- Experience with jQuery and mobile-first layout libraries (e.g. Bootstrap)
- Familiar with the Atlassian product suite (Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence)

Our Software Engineers build products on a variety of platforms and digital mediums, including web and mobile apps, wearables, and other custom hardware. They are passionate about teaching and learning while creating durable, testable code with a relentless commitment to product quality. If you're looking for an amazing opportunity to help us build the future while working with an incredibly dynamic and talented team, we want to work with you!




We're looking for a smart, kind, and reliable Software Engineer who is eager to make a big impact to build and ship high quality products that millions of people use every day.




As a member of our team, you'll be exposed to the entire product lifecycle, from idea generation, design, prototyping, planning, execution, and ultimately shipping the final product to market. You’ll be part of a team that fosters mentorship, encourages continuous learning and development, and shares a passion for writing effective code to build software-powered products.




At Connected, we’re on a mission to build better products. We partner with a variety of clients to deliver impactful software-powered experiences to their users. Our team members are smart, kind, reliable, and excited to continuously teach and learn. Connected is one of Canada’s Top Small and Medium Employers and one of LinkedIn’s Top Startups.





Responsibilities



Create robust, well-tested code to implement impactful software features

Collaborate with engineers, designers, and product managers, from both Connected and our clients’ teams to deliver large software products

Define, promote and enforce engineering best practices on your project team to clients and across Connected

Take ownership, make an impact, and build a habit of shipping quality products

Approach every day with an eagerness to learn and build your skills






Minimum Requirements



Demonstrated expertise with Spring Framework including Spring Boot and Spring MVC

Thorough understanding of building RESTful APIs using microservices architecture

Proficient in Java and/or Kotlin

Strong coding skills with a proven ability to write clean, effective, well-tested code

Experience designing and developing features in large, complex code bases and software systems

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate across disciplines and work closely with clients, even in a remote setting






Bonus Points



Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as GCP, AWS, or Azure

Familiarity with JVM reactive programming frameworks such as Reactor, RxJava, Akka, or Spring WebFlux

Familiarity with no-SQL databases such as MongoDB

Familiarity with Docker

Passion for building products that positively impact users

Enthusiasm for Agile methodologies, Pair Programming, and Test Driven Development (TDD)

Eager to learn new languages, platforms, and technologies

Experience working directly with clients






Perks



RRSP matching

4 weeks’ vacation

Generous extended health benefits

Parental Leave and Maternity Leave

Annual Education Credit for conferences, courses, workshops, and books to support your professional development

Annual Fitness Credit for gym memberships, running shoes, or classes

In 2021, an annual allowance to support a working from home setup

We’re launching a pilot program where you can work from anywhere in the world for up to 30 days

Our quarterly “Disconnect” events which are a chance for us to bond and unwind as a team





To learn more, visit connected.io/careers




Full-time and Contract Positions Available - Apply Today!




At Connected, we know that the best products are built by diverse and inclusive teams - teams that reflect a range of users and experiences. We're looking for product builders with diverse backgrounds - which go beyond the standard education, work experience, and geolocation. If you want to change how product development is approached, and who products are built for, we encourage you to apply.




We also know that some people aren't comfortable applying unless they feel totally qualified. If you're on the fence or unsure if your experience perfectly matches our job posting, we'd really like you to apply. We are happy to chat and get to know you better, and you can get to know us better as well.




We are also committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process for individuals with disabilities, in line with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you need an accommodation, reach out to our HR team at hr@connected.io and we’ll work with you to understand what is needed.

job_title: Data & Applied Sciences: Full Time Opportunities for University Graduates
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Hardware Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
Every year, we welcome thousands of university graduates from every corner of the world to join Microsoft. You bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead. 


At Microsoft, our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more and when you begin your career with us, we empower you through the Microsoft Aspire Experience. Those hired into this role are invited to participate in this two-year learning and development experience where you'll build your network, cultivate intentional capabilities and gain perspective into the career opportunities across Microsoft’s many exciting businesses.

We’re a company of learn-it-all’s rather than know-it-alls and our culture is centered around embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Does this sound like you? Learn more about our cultural attributes.


Are you ready to join us and create the future?
 Come as you are, do what you love—start your journey with us today!



Responsibilities



As a Data Scientist, you will formulate approaches to solve problems using well-defined algorithms and data sources. You will incorporate an understanding of product functionality and customer perspective to provide context for those problems. You will use data exploration techniques to discover new questions or opportunities within your problem area and propose applicability and limitations of the data. Successful Data Scientists will interpret the results of their analysis, validate their approach, and learn to monitor, analyze, and iterate to continuously improve.

You will engage with peer stakeholders to produce clear, compelling, actionable insights that influence product and service improvements that will impact millions of customers. As a Data Scientist, you will also engage in the peer review process and act on feedback while learning innovative methods, algorithms, and tools to increase the impact and applicability of your results.



Qualifications




Currently pursuing or completed a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field.

Some Engineering experience and or project course work using large data systems on SQL, Hadoop, etc. 

Proficiency using one or more programming or scripting language to work with data such as: Python, Perl, or C#. 

Some experience and or project course work performing data analysis and applying statistics working with tools such as: Excel, R, MATLAB, AMPL, or SAS. 

Some experience and or project course work with product and service telemetry systems. 

Some A/B Testing or experimentation (this can be from conducting real life science experiments, hypothesis testing in stats etc.) Not required but ideal. 

Some experience or course work applying basic ML to a type of data and or used algorithms to conduct experiments on data. Machine Learning strongly encouraged. 

Passion to learn from your peers, manager, and other stakeholders in the Data Science domain. 

Ability to interact with peers and stakeholders to drive product and business impact. 

Strong interpersonal and communications skills. 


Visit our Careers FAQ Page to learn more about the interview process and answers to commonly asked questions.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Autonomic’s 
open, cloud-based platform — the Transportation Mobility Cloud — will connect the diverse components of urban mobility systems — connected vehicles, mass transit, pedestrians, city infrastructure and service providers — with the goal of orchestrating a safer, more efficient and sustainable transportation network.





About Our Provisioning
 
Team


Before a vehicle can interface with the Transportation Mobility Cloud, it must be registered on the platform. Our team is responsible for making first contact with tens of thousands of vehicles a day, as they roll out of the factory, and registering them onto the platform. With innumerable combinations of data formats, vehicle configurations, and device firmware versions, we are designing services with the flexibility to register each individual vehicle with near-zero downtime.





Job Description 



Build great software in a dynamic, startup, pair-programming environment

Build high performance distributed systems which solve large-scale engineering challenges

Build transportation microservices in Java

Design, architect, and build stream processing systems which deal with unbounded data

Design, build, and deploy software using technologies such as Kubernetes, Kafka, PostgreSQL, gRPC, REST

Participate in all aspects of the product life cycle: conceptual design, development, deployment, and operations.

Acquire deep understanding of technologies, services, and architecture of Autonomic’s products

Participate in on-call rotations for after-hours production support






Minimum Requirements



Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience

2+ years of programming experience in a professional environment

Strong written and verbal skills

Solid understanding of software systems, including the compiler/JVM/garbage collection, distributed systems

Ability to learn new technologies and complex domain logic quickly

Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment using agile software practices

Extremely focused with great attention to detail and accuracy

Exhibit flexibility, prioritization and the ability to multitask

Self-directed, take initiative and excellent project management skills

Professional, friendly and approachable at all times

Sound understanding of object-oriented, functional, and reactive programming principles

Flexibility for occasional international travel






Preferred Qualifications



2+ years of experience building microservices with Spring Boot/Java

1+ years of experience with distributed messaging and streaming platforms, such as Apache Kafka Streams

1+ years of experience in working with observability/traceability technologies like Grafana, Prometheus, Honeycomb, Jaeger etc.

1+ years of experience in working in a pair-programming environment






Job Title For This Position


Our job positions are broken down internally based on job competencies that are specific to each role. Should you be hired with us, the job title that you are hired under may therefore differ slightly from what is advertised in this job posting to best align with the competencies of the role and your specific background and experience.





Our Statement Regarding Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity


Autonomic is committed to equal opportunity in employment and to fostering a diverse workforce, free from harassment and discrimination, in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity.




Autonomic does not discriminate on the basis of any grounds prohibited by applicable laws. Autonomic’s equal employment opportunity and nondiscrimination policies apply to all employees, all applicants for employment, and all aspects of the employment relationship.




Accommodations for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment processes, where needed, are available upon request. Please let us know if you need assistance completing or participating in the application process.




We consider diversity in our workforce to be an invaluable asset, and we strive to provide an inclusive work environment in which different ideas, perspectives, and beliefs are respected. It is the duty of every employee to assist Autonomic in maintaining this culture of inclusion.





Background Checks


Applicants who receive a job offer will undergo background checks. Autonomic complies with applicable laws regarding background checks, and applicants will be provided an opportunity to explain and correct any criminal history background information during the hiring process.





Applicant Certification


By submitting an application, I hereby certify that:


I accurately disclosed all relevant information on this application and will, in the future, provide accurate information throughout the hiring process.

I understand that any false statement, representation or omission of requested information may result in disqualification from employment with Autonomic, or, if discovered after I am hired, termination of employment.I understand the application is not an employment agreement, that (for U.S. locations only) employment with Autonomic is at will, and that employment is conditioned upon receipt of satisfactory background checks and provision of documentary proof of my legal right to work in the US or Canada, as applicable.

Web Developer (ASP.Net Core, C#)


Help us build some of the most exciting supply chain solutions for the world’s biggest brands.




We’re a passionate team behind the industry’s most disruptive supply chain platform used by thousands of users every day.





About the job 


We’re looking for expert talent to work as part of our core Development Group to help shape and build the future of our supply chain tools and products.




In this role you will spend time developing and improving our projects, building new ideas and contributing to our Microservices Roadmaps. Your daily activities would include:





Problem solving, helping customers achieve the impossible through brilliantly executed software development

Implementing new frameworks and data methods

Relentlessly obsessing over code performance and bullet-proof reliability

Working with our Development Group team to build and deliver performant code deployed at Scale

Contributing to the ideation and development of our Microservices Roadmaps

Driving process improvement in all aspects of our SDLC

Obsessing over code performance and bullet-proof reliability

Maintaining a sense of curiosity and discovery as we build new ideas





Here are a few solutions we’ve recently launched with our customers:





Manufacturing execution and team collaboration platform for the World’s largest Cosmetics Brand

Factory Direct Shipping platform for one of the largest Consumer Electronics & Entertainment Companies

Fully-autonomous freight audit platform for a 132 Year-old Heavy-Industry Multinational





...and we’re just getting started.





About you


We’re looking for someone with expert knowledge in ASP.Net Core and Web App development. Experience with microservices and at-scale web architectures is a bonus. More important that specific technical skills though is that you’re a strong problem solver who loves to learn – we’re not experts in everything and we don’t expect you to be either.




Here are some of the technologies we work with day-to-day right now:





Azure cloud services

ASP.Net Core +

C#, JavaScript

SQL

DevOps

Unity

AR/VR

HTML / TailwindCSS


 


Pay and Benefits


This is a full time (40 hours per week) position. Currently our team is working mostly remote, but together we are excited about re-uniting in our beautiful new space. Moving forward we will always maintain the same level of flexibility, allowing our team to work from wherever they are most comfortable and productive. 




The salary for this position starts at $60,000 for someone with solid web development skills and goes up to $250,000 for someone who can really level up our team in a big way outside of purely task-directed web development.




We are committed to working at a sustainable and healthy pace, we will provide you any equipment you need to do your best work, including computer, external displays, office chairs, keyboards, --whatever you need.





How to apply


To apply, write something specifically for this position that tells us why we’re a great fit for each other, and what you see the future being like if we work together. Please showcase 2-3 projects you’ve worked on recently and tell us what you think we should know about them. If you’ve got anything you designed, developed and shipped entirely by yourself, we’d really love to see it and hear the story.




We don’t ask for your resume, but that doesn’t mean we’re not interested in what you’ve worked on in the past, we’re just leaving it up to you to tell your story the way you want to tell it.





A Note


LNI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please let us know and we will be more than happy to accommodate.

What is the opportunity?

This is an exciting opportunity to join our Next Gen Solution Delivery team that is focused on developing a system that helps RBC development teams securely deliver software faster and smarter to multiple Cloud platforms. As a member of a product-focused, agile managed team, you will be helping build cloud-native applications and be exposed to various DevOps tools (Jenkins, UCD, SonarQube, Checkmarx, etc), Cloud Platforms (PCF, OpenShift, Azure and AWS) and modern technologies such as Elasticsearch, Redis, and Kafka. Take advantage of a unique opportunity to make an impact and contribute to changing the way software development is done at RBC and improving the development experience of RBC's large development community.

What will you do?


 Develop micro-frontend components with React.

 Develop microservices with Java Spring Boot to interact with frontend and other services.

 Building a multi-cloud solution.

 Troubleshoot and investigate issues as they arise.


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


 Programming experience with Java and JavaScript/Typescript

 Experience in Spring Framework and React

 Knowledge of software design patterns and coding best practices

 Willingness to take on challenges and enthusiasm for learning

 Team centric attitude


Nice-to-have


 Experience in designing, writing and building microservice application.

 Knowledge of developing distributed cloud applications (Cloud Foundry, Kubernetes)

 Knowledge of Kafka and Elasticsearch.


What's in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge of designing the best cloud platform and enabling our developers to be extremely productive. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

 A world-class training program in financial services

 Flexible work/life balance options


RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.



Job Summary



City: Toronto

Address: 330 Front Street, Toronto, ON

Work Hours/Week: 37.5

Work Environment: Office

Employment Type: Permanent

Career Level: Experienced Hire/Professional

Pay Type: Salary + Variable Bonus

Required Travel (%): 0

Exempt/Non-Exempt: N/A

People Manager: No

Application Deadline: 03/18/2022

Platform: Technology and Operations

Req ID: 454980

Lead Front-End Developer


Help us design and build the most beautiful supply chain solutions for the world’s biggest brands.




We’re a passionate team behind the industry’s most innovative supply chain platform used by thousands of users every day. We are relentlessly building pixel-perfect experiences that help our customers push the limits of supply chain and stay connected to what matters most.





About the job


We’re looking for someone to work closely with our Development Group to help shape and build the future of our supply chain tools and products.




You’d spend your time developing and improving existing projects and creating entirely new ideas for example:


Building new components and data-rich features on a native web-app platform

Implementing design and componentization strategies for our Product and SaaS Roadmap

Re-defining best-practices to support edge technology and frameworks

Crafting experiences and user workflows using styles and animations

Discovering ways to bridge the gaps between users and screens in both Virtual and Augmented spaces





Working together with our team, you would spend additional time programming, testing, discovering, brainstorming on hard problems, prototyping different ideas, throwing them away, and prototyping them again. You wouldn’t just be churning through tickets in a backlog – you’d be helping to design entirely new products, figuring out what exactly we’re building and why.





About you


We’re looking for someone with very strong font-end skills who is an expert in modern web components, with an solid understanding of CSS and design-first principles. More important than specific technical skills, is that you’re a strong problem solver who loves to learn – we’re not experts in everything and we don’t expect you to be either.




Here are some technologies we work with day-to-day right now:


Tailwind CSS

ASP.Net Core

HTML, CSS, JavaScript

C#, SQL

Unity

Azure DevOps






Pay and Benefits


This is a full time (40 hours per week) position. Currently our team is working mostly remote, but together we are excited about re-uniting in our beautiful new space. Moving forward we will always maintain the same level of flexibility, allowing our team to work from wherever they are most comfortable and productive. 




The salary for this position starts at $60,000 for someone with excellent UI design skills and goes up to $210,000 for someone who can really level up our team in a big way outside of purely interface design role.




We are committed to working at a sustainable and healthy pace, we will provide you any equipment you need to do your best work, including computer, external displays, office chairs, keyboards, --whatever you need.





How to apply


To apply, write something specifically for this position that tells us why we’re a great fit for each other, and what you see the future being like if we work together. Please showcase 2-3 projects you’ve worked on recently and tell us what you think we should know about them. If you’ve got anything you designed, developed and shipped entirely by yourself, we’d really love to see it and hear the story.




We don’t ask for your resume, but that doesn’t mean we’re not interested in what you’ve worked on in the past, we’re just leaving it up to you to tell your story the way you want to tell it.





A note


LNI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please let us know and we will be more than happy to accommodate.




We can't wait to hear from you!

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing Services, and Software Development
description:
Co-Op – (QA) Software Developer in Test – Enterprise Resource Planning, Oracle NetSuite 



At Oracle NetSuite, we build the best-in-class system for automating business processes. We help our customers run their businesses and scale with them as they grow. As a premier part of Oracle’s organization, Development teams at NetSuite enjoys a start-up culture with the added benefits of the strength and stability of a global organization. Our work environment is open and agile. We thrive on collaboration and global partnership to build a seamlessly integrated suite of features and flexible solutions. We have developers and product owners in eight offices worldwide, all rallying around one common purpose – helping our customers achieve their goals.

NetSuite developers do more than write code. We become specialists in our business domain and take the time to deeply understand our customers’ goals. We own the design of our product, bringing questions and ideas to the table and analyzing them. We develop greenfield code for new engines as well as maintain a powerful legacy codebase.


So, you're interested in a co-op? We're looking for students who have great attention to detail, are currently enrolled in a Computer Science or Engineering degree with experience with object-oriented or scripting language (academic or industry) and understand HTML, CSS and DOM. If you enjoy critical thinking and problem solving and are a strong communicator, take this as a sign to apply!


Co-Op students at NetSuite are a key part of the larger teams success and are treated like full-time employees. When you join our co-op program, you will be given a mentor to help you succeed and achieve your goals. We have a thriving co-op social program across our North American offices and create the space for you to network with and get to know our senior leaders. Looking for more information? Read 
this blog post
 where our co-op students (many are now full-time!) tell you more about their experience in our program.



Curious about what you'll do? Here's a sample of tasks and projects our co-op students work on:




Play a part in the delivery of high-quality testable software, from requirement analysis to implementation and acceptance testing.

Implement automated tests for a database-driven web application.

Participate in test plan creation and ensure comprehensive test coverage of features.

Join the team’s code review process in an active and timely fashion.

Take part in the resolution of production issues and work with team members, including Technical Support teams, to see the resolution through to completion.

Collaborate with fellow team members across all roles to deliver on a shared responsibility for quality.

Assist in product roadmap discussions and implementation.

Follow the mentorship of full-time team members.

Participate in initiatives that make us stronger as a team (e.g. internal dash-boarding, metrics for our success in production, improved build processes).

Contribute ideas and effort for continuous improvement for the team, in its Agile process and in its general team effectiveness.

 

We encourage you to apply if you have most (or all!!) of the following:




Experience with relational databases and SQL

Understanding of HTML, CSS and DOM

A passion for software quality

Knowledge of QA processes and methodologies

Co-op/intern or other industry experience in software is a plus

 

What we provide:




Competitive salary for co-op's in the technology and software industry.

Work life balance – Our world-wide team supports each other so that your evenings and weekends are actually your own.

A hybrid/remote work week, which gives you more flexibility to work from the location that is best for you.

Regular team events that range from digital puzzles and video games to drive-ins and donut parties.

Access to learning and skills development platforms as well as mentorship opportunities for all program participants.

 

Our commitment to you:



We don’t just value differences—we celebrate them. We’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people work together. We believe innovation starts with diversity and inclusion.Oracle NetSuite is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veteran’s status or any other characteristic protected by law.

This job code is utilized for the majority of our temporary hires. The individual is performing hourly job duties as defined under the Fair Labor Standards Act.

Android Developer

We are actively growing the team and have an urgent need to bring on multiple mobile developers. If you are passionate about app development and love working with a dynamic team, then come join us!

What You Will Be Doing

As a Android Developer, you will be expected to have a strong understanding of mobile development technologies and feel comfortable working on mobile development with our engineering team.

What You Need for this Position



Must Have

 HTML, CSS

 Javascript

 Kotlin is a nice or other android development languages


What's In It for You

Our client is a leading financial services company located downtown and they have an immediate need for a Software Development Engineer in Test. This role will be responsible for building robust, scalable and high-quality test plans and test automation solutions. They will collaborate with the QA team and developers through the SDLC to ensure high quality deliverables throughout the company. The Software Development Engineer in Test will also be responsible for aiding in testing their internal systems with: functional testing, black box testing, white box testing and using agile methodologies.





Responsibilities



Design, develop, maintain, and enhance test automation systems and tools for use by test engineers, and QA

Contribute to the creation, extension, and communication of test automation best practices

Perform source code analysis to determine quality gaps and communicate high risk areas

Assist in assessing product quality and release readiness

Facilitate creation and execution of automated test suites

Analyze test automation failures and determine the root cause from source code

Participating in design and architectural discussions

Help ensure new code moves easily through our deployment pipeline

Assist with the testing of all programming changes affecting their software, b2b connections, webservice calls, documents, underwriting systems, websites, etc. All testing is to be documented and reviewed before sign-off 

Assist users with any question or concerns relating to their underwriting software and/or products

Assist with preparing for the implementation of software and product changes

Complete other duties as assigned by the Director



 



Requirements



Over 5 years work experience of using C# and Selenium Webdriver as automation testing tool

1 or 2 years of experience using API/service testing tools (SoapUI, Postman)

Ability to design and develop robust and reusable automation test framework & infrastructure from scratch

Experience in source configuration tool GIT

Software development background is preferred

Proficiency with SQL and an understanding of relational database systems

Understanding of software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including agile software development

Work experience of object-oriented design and development

Experience with, or desire to work, in an agile development environment

Strong debugging, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills

Experience with Neoload or LoadRunner is an asset

Experience with Testcomplete is an asset

Experience in testing Angular JS applications using Protractor is an asset





If you are interested in this opportunity, please forward your resume to ray.sacuevo@redbranchsearch.com

NATURE & SCOPE OF POSITION






Database/Application Developer


 This position is a Database/Application Developer working to develop new and extend existing applications in the CHS portfolio. You will work closely with various departments within the organization to design and build end user facing applications, data integration, and reporting solutions using industry leading tools. You may be required to work on multiple concurrent projects. In addition, you will also be responsible for the ongoing maintenance and support of the applications.


Key Responsibilities



Design and develop Microsoft 365 applications and solutions using Power Automate (Flow), Power Apps, SharePoint, Azure services

Debug, fix, improve existing workflows and solutions and suggest changes.

Retire existing legacy applications and implement custom solutions to leverage various Microsoft 365 services.

Design and implement logical and physical data models and solutions to support reporting systems and analysis.

Develop data integration and ETL/ELT solutions between our various databases and business systems.

Assist in applying system solutions to business problems through the design and programming of Dynamics 365.



Skills



Strong understanding of Power Automate (Flow), Power Apps, SharePoint

JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, ASP.NET

Mobile web optimization techniques

API development and Integration

Strong knowledge of Microsoft BI technology (SSRS, SSIS, SSAS and Power BI).

Knowledge of database architecture and design principles and various database management systems (MS SQL Server, Azure SQL, DB2, MySQL)

Very strong understanding of MS SQL Server, T-SQL, and relational databases.

Knowledge of how to design, develop and test Microsoft Dynamics CRM, APIs, Workflows, and integrations.

Agile Tools related experience: Confluence, Jira






Requirements



Bachelor’s degree in IT related field.

Software development experience in Healthcare and Manufacturing is an asset

3+ years of Microsoft Power Apps / Power Automate / Power Platform experience, SharePoint. Certification is a plus.

3+ years building and developing data integration ETL workflows from multiple sources including not limited to MS SQL Server, Azure SQL, DB2, MySQL, flat files, JSON, APIs.

Knowledge in Microsoft enterprise cloud technologies such as Dynamics 365 CRM, Office 365 and Microsoft Azure

Agile developer experience

Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic team environment.

Proven ability to meet deadlines and take initiative.

Must be highly fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Bilingual (French/English) is an asset

Our Software Engineers build products on a variety of platforms and digital mediums, including web and mobile apps, wearables, and other custom hardware. They are passionate about teaching and learning while creating durable, testable code with a relentless commitment to product quality. If you're looking for an amazing opportunity to help us build the future while working with an incredibly dynamic and talented team, we want to work with you!




We're looking for a smart, kind, and reliable Software Engineer who is eager to make a big impact to build and ship high quality products that millions of people use every day.




As a member of our team, you'll be exposed to the entire product lifecycle, from idea generation, design, prototyping, planning, execution, and ultimately shipping the final product to market. You’ll be part of a team that fosters mentorship, encourages continuous learning and development, and shares a passion for writing effective code to build software-powered products.




At Connected, we’re on a mission to build better products. We partner with a variety of clients to deliver impactful software-powered experiences to their users. Our team members are smart, kind, reliable, and excited to continuously teach and learn. Connected is one of Canada’s Top Small and Medium Employers and one of LinkedIn’s Top Startups.





Responsibilities:



Create robust, well-tested code to implement impactful software features

Collaborate with engineers, designers, and product managers, from both Connected and our clients’ teams to deliver large software products

Take ownership, make an impact, and build a habit of shipping quality products

Approach every day with an eagerness to learn and build your skills






Qualifications:



Demonstrated expertise with at least one of the following platforms, languages, and frameworks: Frontend Web - JavaScript, TypeScript, React; Backend Web - Java, Spring, Ruby on Rails, Python, PHP, JavaScript, TypeScript, Hack, NodeJS, Go; Android - Kotlin, Java; iOS - Swift, Objective-C; Cross-Platform - React Native. We are open to specialists in any of these areas, and generalists as well.

Strong coding skills with a proven ability to write clean, effective, well-tested code

Eager to learn new languages, platforms, and technologies

Comfort with remote collaboration across disciplines






Bonus Points



Passion for building products that positively impact users

Enthusiasm for Agile methodologies, Pair Programming, and Test Driven Development (TDD)

Experience working directly with clients






Perks:



RRSP Matching

4 weeks’ vacation

Generous extended health benefits

Wellness Initiatives to support work life balance

Parental Leave and Maternity Leave

Annual Education Credit for conferences, courses, workshops, and books to support your professional development

Annual Fitness Credit for gym memberships, running shoes, or classes

In 2021, an annual allowance to support a working from home setup

Our quarterly “Disconnect” events which are a chance for us to bond and unwind as a team





To learn more, visit connected.io/careers




Full-time and Contract Positions Available - Apply Today!




At Connected, we know that the best products are built by diverse and inclusive teams - teams that reflect a range of users and experiences. We're looking for product builders with diverse backgrounds - which go beyond the standard education, work experience, and geolocation. If you want to change how product development is approached, and who products are built for, we encourage you to apply.




We also know that some people aren't comfortable applying unless they feel totally qualified. If you're on the fence or unsure if your experience perfectly matches our job posting, we'd really like you to apply. We are happy to chat and get to know you better, and you can get to know us better as well.




We are also committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process for individuals with disabilities, in line with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you need an accommodation, reach out to our HR team at hr@connected.io and we’ll work with you to understand what is needed.

job_title: Software Development Engineer | Amazon Delivery Experience
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description



For millions of customers worldwide, the Amazon name is synonymous with delivery – and the Delivery Experience (DEX) team provides those customers with innovative ways to get what they want and need, enabling the choices they make on every order, every day. We combine customer impact with retail invention, solving huge technical challenges along the way.


 This is SUPER high-visibility work: Our mission is to provide consistent, accurate, and relevant delivery information to every single page on every Amazon-owned site.

 MILLIONS of customers will be impacted by your contributions: The changes we make directly impact the customer experience on every Amazon site. This is a great position for someone who likes backend development and Service Oriented Architecture, but wants to see and measure their direct impact on customers.

 We are a cross-functional team that owns the ENTIRE delivery experience for customers: From the business requirements to the technical systems that allow us to directly affect the on-site experience from a central service, business and technical team members are integrated so everyone is involved through the entire development process.


As a Software Development Engineer for Delivery Experience, you will be responsible for services and features that improve the discoverability of delivery options for all customers, and utilize our current delivery experience architecture. To succeed, the skill to build highly scalable, fault-tolerant systems that can withstand millions of operations per day will not be enough. You will be responsible for projects that require enhancements to multiple systems, including many outside your team's ownership. You’ll need a proven ability to architect elegant solutions to new challenges spanning multiple systems, and to effectively share your technical vision with others. You will be working with multiple teams across the company in many different areas, so collaboration skills are a must. So, if you’re creative, talented, have a strong sense of both technical and business ownership, and enjoy solving complex challenges that have a huge impact on all of Amazon’s customers, we’ve definitely got the role for you!

Individuals interested in this position should have practical experience in building high-performance, reliable systems in a complex, multi-tiered, and distributed environment. The ideal candidate will have experience working across the stack, from Java on the back-end to HTML / CSS / JS / React Native on the front-end as well as expertise in API design.




Basic Qualifications




 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience

 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.




Preferred Qualifications




 Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design

 Computer Science fundamentals in data structures

 Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

 Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as Java, C, C++, C#, or Perl

 Experience with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)

 Experience collaborating with other teams to build scalable and fault tolerant solutions

 Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

 Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

 Experience with distributed computing and enterprise-wide systems

 Experience with web and mobile app technologies

 Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy

 Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills and make them more effective, productive software engineers

 Experience influencing software engineering best practices within your team

 Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, ranging from front-end user interfaces through back-end systems and all points in between


By submitting your application here, you can apply once to be considered for multiple Software Engineer openings across various Amazon teams. If you are successful in passing through the initial application review and assessment, you will be asked to submit your career and personal preferences so that our dedicated recruiters can match you to the right role based on these preferences.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us .



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

job_title: Software Engineer, Cloud - New College Grad 2022
industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Software Development, and Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
For two decades, we have pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics. With our invention of the GPU - the engine of modern visual computing - the field has grown to encompass video games, movie production, product design, medical diagnosis and scientific research. Today, we stand at the beginning of the next era, the AI computing era, ignited by a new computing model, GPU deep learning. This new model - where deep neural networks are trained to recognize patterns from massive amounts of data - has shown to be deeply effective at solving the most complex problems in everyday life.

We’re just getting started, and the Isaac Sim team is now looking for a 
Cloud Engineer
 to help build the future of robotics simulation.



What You’ll Be Doing




 Design & development of a cloud platform for Isaac Sim 

 Build docker containers and ensure an easy to use experience with running application on the cloud 

 Design and develop platform for running multiple instances in headless mode. 

 Participate in the large-scale deployment in the data center of Isaac Sim and its supporting tools. 

 Create innovative ways to define validation scenarios 

 Developing CI/CD tool sets 

 Measure critical metrics of the simulator in terms of functionality and performance. 




What We Need To See




Completing or recently completedBS, MS, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience)

 3+ years of work experience working on data and cloud platforms 

 Experience in designing architectural solutions for cloud platform 

 Experience with Docker, Scalable Cloud, & Kubernetes used for scale and deployment 

 Excellent C++, Python programming & well versed in other scripting languages 

 Excellent data skills & software design 

 Ability to learn fast & debug complex system issues 

 Strong communication skills & ability to work across teams 




Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd




 Experience with Robotics 

 Experience with Simulation, physics simulation software, sensor simulation, version control. 

 Familiar with AI concepts: Supervised Learning, Reinforcement Learning. 

 Background with data-parallel and/or accelerated computing (CUDA, OpenCL). 

 Experience with Universal Scene Description (USD). 

 Prior experience with game/physics engine development, code optimization

job_title: Machine Vision Engineer - Machine Learning, Data Mining, CNN
description:

On-Site 2 days a week

$80K-$130K CAD

Lead, design and implement ground breaking vision algorithms (core and applied research), leveraging the latest advances in machine learning, advancing current and future GEO offerings

Help define the companys R&D direction in Object Detection and Recognition

M.S., Ph.D. in Computer Science or a related field (Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or Electrical and/or Computer engineering)

Computer Vision - Object Detection/Recognition, scene understanding

Machine Learning/Pattern Recognition - Classification, Regression

Data Mining techniques

Experience with Deep Learning techniques (CNNs, RNNs)

Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably. Our engineers and scientists in research and development are developing revolutionary technologies that are changing the way the world works and how industries do business. We constantly push the boundaries of conventions, while continuing to focus on customer satisfaction. The ABB Measurement & Analytics plant in QuÃ©bec is one of the world leaders in spectroscopy meeting several industrial analysis needs. Our Contract Engineering Department is Canada's largest supplier of space optical sensors used worldwide for greenhouse gas emissions monitoring and weather forecasting. The plant is known for its expertise in the development and manufacture of industrial optical sensing products. As such, you will act as a software developer as part of a multidisciplinary research and development team. The latter is responsible for analyzing, designing, implementing, and integrating solutions for clients such as the Canadian Space Agency, but also for our analysis and measurement products. (https://new.abb.com/products/measurement-products).

This position reports to

Principal Designer

Your responsibilities


 Look for new ideas for technological innovation and share expertise at the team meetings and in the technical reports.

 Participate in the design and development of our next generations of products, but also of scientific instruments

 developed specifically for a client.

 Participate in the product support in collaboration with the other departments of the company.

 Participate in the project estimate, functional analysis, design and code review processes, and in transfer to production.

 Participate in integration testing.

 Participate in document writing.

 Analyze and solve complex problems for the development of innovative solutions.

 Living ABB's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for

 your colleagues and the business.


Your background


 University degree in computer science or college degree with relevant experience.

 Good knowledge of Linux systems and C/C, Python and JAVA programming languages.

 Knowledge of object-oriented design and modeling (UML, Magic Draw, Enterprise Architect).

 Deep commitment to safe work practices and to compliance with all relevant workplace safety guidelines.

 Passionate, resourceful and disciplined. Your ability to work as a team must be strong due to the nature of our projects.

 Your ability to integrate and be receptive will be an indispensable asset to evolve well in the organization.

 Strong personal motivation, curiosity and desire to learn new technologies, autonomy, initiative, concern for order and

 quality.

 Collaborative and solution-oriented approach and strong communication skills.




Benefits




 Retirement plan

 Medical insurance

 Wellbeing program


More about us

Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

Off2Class is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, and Indigenous status.





Off2Class is looking for a 
Junior Developer (PHP/Vue)
 as an integral support to the Dev Team, who is excited to code the future of language learning. You'll be working directly with our CTO and part of a small team.




We are looking for someone with a willingness to learn and contribute with their experience. The successful candidate will be meticulous and thorough. As a small company, we are looking for someone who can carry out back/front-end design and implementation, with minor supervision but full support. You’ll also ensure that the website maintains a high level of availability and that new code releases minimize any negative impacts on our users. 





Who Are We?





Off2Class is a SaaS tool for English as a Second Language (ESL) teachers and schools. Some of the largest online ESL schools on the web are powered by us, as well as many bricks-and-mortar programs. We are bootstrapped, founder-led and profitable. 





Company Values and Culture






Competitiveness, Entrepreneurship, Inclusivity, Diversity, Internationalism, Progressiveness, Sensitivity, Compassion, and Humor.
 These are the values from which Off2Class was born. They are the values that form the backbone of our strategy. They influence how we sell our product, develop our content, code our features, and interact with our users and each other. Such values help us do good, be better and build the best ESL product on the market. In line with our focus on a diverse and inclusive workplace, we encourage and welcome candidates from under-represented and minority backgrounds to apply for this position.





Flexible Work Policy





At Off2Class we recognize that team members appreciate a flexible work policy, and while we offer this role remotely, applicants for this position must be prepared to work from an Off2Class office in Toronto, if needed and permitted in the future.





The Position





As a fast-growing company, we first need a ‘doer’ and someone with an ‘everything-is-figure-out
able
’ attitude. In this role, you will collaborate with other developers and design computer applications and programs. Part of these responsibilities includes writing and debugging code, so we are looking for applicants familiar with PHP, JavaScript, and HTML/CSS. You should also be comfortable using VueJS and Laravel frameworks.





What You Will Do






Develop both the backend and frontend of Off2Class Software by using PHP  (Laravel framework) and Vue.js 

Maintain Off2Class’s WordPress Blog and regularly update core and plugins 

Triage and log incoming customer/internal issues

Test new features before publication and handle bug tracking for the development team 

Regularly monitor and report on the health and stability of Off2Class’s server 

Collaborate with the senior developers on the development of roadmaps 

Assist and inform non-technical members of the Off2Class team about various  product features, including support of the administration panel 

Assist with work on other features, functions, and areas of the Off2Class website and software as needed






What Success Will Look Like





We are looking for someone who is ready to jump in, learn fast and help us maintain our rate of growth. Here’s what we believe it will take to achieve this.





Month 1:


You have set up the development environment.




You have reviewed the app codebase from a high level.




You understand the development pipeline from idea to release.

 

You have completed several bugs/tweaks.




You understand the role of the tools that we use (Monday.com, Mantis, Chat, Slack, Drive, etc.) in the development process.





Month 2: 


You are working on the development and implementation of a feature with the product manager.




You are providing timely feedback on the feature specs and reporting on the development of the feature on a daily basis.




You have met with each Off2Class Team member remotely and have an overview of the role of each person in the team.




You have presented a workshop to the Off2Class Team in which you presented a topic of personal and professional interest.







 
Month 3:
 

You have a good understanding of our coding policies, have thoroughly reviewed all code to find bugs, and have made code suggestions to maintain a clean, simple codebase




You have clearly demonstrated an entrepreneurial attitude, have taken and continue to take ownership of your tasks,  and you are communicating at the level Off2Class needs to scale our product in 2022 and beyond.





Whom Are We Looking For?





We are looking for someone who thinks ‘in systems’ and is highly skilled at building repeatable processes. You think on your feet, have a roll-up-your-sleeves-and-get-stuff-done attitude, and think and communicate proactively. You build and maintain relationships easily and keep open lines of communication and trust with leadership and fellow colleagues.





Specific Skills and Must-Have Experience:



2-3 years PHP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS

Ability to find bugs from reading code and manual testing

Experience using SQL to update and retrieve data

Experience in front-end and back-end software development

Experience with database management and security a plus

Proactive, “can-do” attitude and approach to your work

Superior language, communication, and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written (we sell software to English Teachers!)






What We Offer





Here are some of the perks you’ll enjoy while working at Off2Class





Competitive salary: 60-65K CAD depending on experience

Casual Dress 

Employee social activities and team building events 

Remote work

3 weeks paid vacation

Personal days

Employee Health Benefits package

Flexible work schedule






How to Apply:


Attach your CV and include a cover letter that answers the following questions:





Why do you want to work for Off2Class?

Which of the Off2Class company values speaks to you the most?

How does the unique experience on your CV relate to this job description? (Be specific and provide examples)

Provide code samples (such as git hub). Any sample documentation, output, or code from data analysis. 





Submit your CV and cover letter to leanne@off2class.com.

Associate Software Engineer



Location: Toronto, ON





We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Full Stack Java Developer to join our growing Workforce Management organization. Infor Workforce Management is a powerful scheduling solution that focuses on employee scheduling, and time and attendance tracking, serving a Fortune 500 client portfolio. 

 

You would be joining a dynamic, fast-paced, cross-functional team composed of business analysts, developers, architects, product owners and quality assurance analysts delivering a portfolio of world-class products. We offer an Agile environment in which you can work on challenging problems that that will keep you engaged and learning all the time. If you want to build beautiful software, contact us.


 







A Day in The Life Typically Includes:




 


· Working as part of a dynamic Agile team to develop and deliver our enterprise scheduling solution

· Collaborating with designers and UI developers to bring the designs to life

· Learning functional and technical details of the product.

· Improving software performance, scalability, stability, and usability.

· Technically reviewing and functionally testing the work of other team members.





What You Will Need:



Basic Qualifications:


· Basic Java development experience, including knowledge of JSP, Servlets, JDBC, Spring Framework

· Experience with web application development: HTML5, CSS, Javascript, JQuery

· Experience with least one of Angular2, AngularJS, React, Node.js

· Experience with Databases and SQL


 Basic knowledge in any of these databases: Oracle, Postgres, DB2, MySQL 

 Strong grasp of relational database concepts 


· Experience with application servers such as Oracle WebLogic, IBM Web Sphere, Wildfly

· Experience with tools like Ant, Maven, SonarQube, Jenkins, etc.

· Strong leadership and communication with self-starter attitude and attention to detail

· Ability to quickly grasp concepts, analyze problems and provide innovative solutions

 


What Will Put You Ahead?


Preferred Qualifications:

· Exposure to:


 Servlets, Web Services

 HTML5, CSS, COMPASS, SASS, LESS

 AJAX, JSON, SOAP, REST


· Understanding of different OS Memory management strategies, heap structure, and design patterns.

· Good knowledge of TDD and Unit testing

· Experience with a Time and Attendance or Scheduling application is a plus.

· Experience with Docker and Kubernetes.


 



Infor values:


Our Guiding Principles set the standard for how we work with one another. They define who we are as an organization and guide everything we do. By applying the same shared values that unleash prosperity in free societies—such as value creation, integrity, responsibility, free speech, and toleration—we encourage one another to take initiative and to challenge the status quo.

 

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on a business philosophy called Market Based Management® (MBM®). Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, MBM® prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
